metaTitle: 3-Bed Penthouse €329,990 San Miguel de Salinas Costa Blanca
metaDescription: Luxury 3-bedroom penthouse in San Miguel de Salinas. €329,990. Premium specification, 40% less than island markets. Ideal for retirees.
heroIntro:
Welcome to your peaceful retirement haven on the Costa Blanca. This exceptional 3-bedroom penthouse in San Miguel de Salinas offers the perfect blend of relaxed Mediterranean living and modern comfort at just €329,990. Priced at €4,125 per square meter, this premium specification property represents outstanding value—40% less than comparable properties on Spain's popular island markets, yet offering the same high-quality finishes and amenities that discerning buyers expect.

San Miguel de Salinas has become increasingly popular with retirees seeking a slower pace of life without sacrificing convenience or community. This charming Pueblo location welcomes an established expat community where English is widely spoken, healthcare facilities are excellent, and the year-round sunshine creates the ideal backdrop for enjoying your well-deserved retirement. Whether you're looking for a permanent residence or a base for winter escapes, this penthouse delivers everything you need for easy living in one of Spain's most desirable regions.

With 15 high-quality images showcasing the property's thoughtful design and modern amenities, this is a home ready to welcome you home. The rising market—up 8% year-on-year in the region—means your investment is positioned for solid appreciation while you enjoy the Spanish lifestyle you've always dreamed of.
areaSection: San Miguel de Salinas is a authentic Spanish pueblo nestled in the heart of the Costa Blanca, approximately 40 kilometers south of Alicante. Unlike the more touristy coastal areas, this inland location preserves genuine Spanish character while remaining just minutes from stunning Mediterranean beaches. The town sits at the crossroads of accessibility and tranquility: you're close enough to cosmopolitan amenities yet far enough to escape the summer crowds. The region boasts a mild climate year-round, with warm, dry summers and temperate winters perfect for outdoor living. The local community is genuinely welcoming to international residents, with a well-established network of British, German, and Northern European families who've chosen this area for retirement. The surrounding landscape features rolling hills, salt lakes (Las Salinas), and agricultural terraces that give the region its distinctive charm and identity.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in San Miguel de Salinas revolves around community, outdoor enjoyment, and the relaxed Spanish approach to living. The town center buzzes with activity on market days, when locals and visitors gather at the weekly markets for fresh produce and local goods. You'll find excellent restaurants serving traditional Spanish cuisine alongside international options, many with terraces perfect for lingering over coffee or evening meals. The established expat community means you'll find English speakers everywhere, from healthcare professionals to shopkeepers, removing the stress many retirees worry about. Weekly social activities, golf clubs, and hobby groups provide natural opportunities to build friendships and stay engaged. The proximity to Blue Flag beaches means a pleasant 20-minute drive gets you to pristine Mediterranean shoreline for swimming, walking, or simply enjoying the sea air. Shopping is convenient with modern supermarkets like Mercadona and Lidl alongside traditional markets, and excellent healthcare with English-speaking doctors ensures peace of mind for your wellbeing.
investmentSection: Beyond providing your perfect retirement home, this penthouse represents a sound financial investment. The Costa Blanca property market has demonstrated consistent growth, with San Miguel de Salinas appreciating 8% year-on-year—a healthy trend reflecting increasing international demand. At €4,125 per square meter, this property sits at a premium within the local market (area average €2,200/m²), reflecting its superior specification and condition. The rental potential is equally attractive: comparable properties in the region command approximately €800 for a week's rental, generating attractive returns if you choose to offset your costs through holiday lets during peak season. Many owners successfully balance personal use with seasonal rentals, creating income that helps offset property ownership costs. Unlike properties on Spain's island markets which command significantly higher per-meter prices, you're acquiring premium-specification property at 40% better value, while still enjoying appreciation potential and the option to generate rental income.
conclusion: This exceptional 3-bedroom penthouse represents your gateway to the peaceful, sun-filled retirement you've envisioned. At €329,990 with premium specification and 40% better value than island markets, combined with San Miguel de Salinas' welcoming expat community, excellent healthcare, and year-round sunshine, you're acquiring far more than a property—you're purchasing a lifestyle. The market's positive trajectory means your investment is positioned for appreciation while you enjoy every day of your well-deserved retirement. The 15 high-quality images showcase exactly what awaits you. Don't let this opportunity pass—contact us today via WhatsApp to arrange a viewing or discuss financing options. Your Spanish retirement dream is closer than you think.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: San Miguel de Salinas excels at providing everything you need for comfortable daily living. Modern amenities blend seamlessly with traditional Spanish community life, ensuring you have both convenience and authenticity. Shopping, dining, healthcare, and transportation are all easily accessible, allowing you to focus on enjoying your retirement rather than managing logistics.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in San Miguel de Salinas is comprehensive and reassuring for retirees. The regional hospital is within 30 minutes' drive, offering emergency services and specialist care. More conveniently, excellent private clinics are available locally with English-speaking doctors and nursing staff familiar with serving international patients. Spain's healthcare system is highly regarded, with costs significantly lower than the UK, and many private providers accept international insurance. Routine care is readily available through local health centers, and prescription medications are affordable. The presence of English-speaking medical professionals removes language barriers that concern many retirees, ensuring you can communicate clearly about your health needs and receive personalized care.

shopping.text: Daily shopping is convenient with major supermarkets including Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum all within minutes of San Miguel de Salinas. These modern stores stock everything from fresh produce to international products, ensuring you can find familiar items from home if desired. Beyond supermarkets, traditional weekly markets in the town center offer fresh local vegetables, fruits, and regional specialties at excellent prices. The experience of shopping at Spanish markets connects you with local life while supporting small vendors. For larger shopping expeditions, Torrevieja city center is just 15 minutes away with modern shopping centers, restaurants, and entertainment options. This blend of convenient supermarkets and authentic markets creates an ideal shopping experience.

transport.text: Getting around the Costa Blanca is straightforward from San Miguel de Salinas. Alicante Airport is approximately 45 minutes away, offering numerous flights to the UK and throughout Europe—ideal for visiting family or exploring beyond your new home. While public transport via bus connections is available for local trips, most residents find a car essential for the flexibility to explore beaches, visit restaurants, and access amenities across the broader region. Driving in Spain is generally pleasant with well-maintained roads, and a car provides the independence to explore at your own pace. Parking in San Miguel de Salinas is straightforward and affordable, unlike congested coastal resorts.

faqs.question: Hvor mye koster denne eiendommen?
faqs.answer: €329,990. This 3-bedroom penthouse is priced at €4,125 per square meter, representing premium specification at 40% better value than comparable properties on Spain's island markets. The price includes modern finishes and a move-in ready condition. Flexible payment options and mortgage arrangements are available for qualified buyers.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca et godt sted å kjøpe eiendom?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is an excellent place to buy property, particularly for retirees. The region shows consistent market appreciation (8% year-on-year in San Miguel de Salinas), offers exceptional value compared to other Spanish markets, provides excellent healthcare and amenities, and hosts a welcoming international community. Properties perform well both as permanent residences and rental investments.

faqs.question: Kan utlendinger kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely buy property in Spain without residency requirements or nationality restrictions. You'll need an NIE (Spanish identification number) and to follow standard purchase procedures. British, EU, and non-EU citizens all have equal property ownership rights. Legal requirements are straightforward with proper guidance from a Spanish property solicitor.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca bra for pensjonister?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is outstanding for retirees. It offers year-round sunshine, exceptional healthcare facilities with English-speaking doctors, established expat communities, affordable cost of living compared to northern Europe, excellent amenities, and proximity to beaches. Many retirees find it the perfect balance of relaxed lifestyle, modern conveniences, and social engagement.

faqs.question: Hva er levekostnadene på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Costa Blanca is significantly lower than the UK or northern Europe. Groceries, dining, healthcare, and utilities are all more affordable. A comfortable retirement lifestyle costs approximately 30-40% less than equivalent living in the UK. This property's rental potential of €800/week can substantially offset ownership costs when used for holiday lets.

faqs.question: Hvordan er været på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys year-round sunshine with an average of 300+ sunny days annually. Summers are warm and dry (28-32°C), while winters are mild (12-15°C) with occasional rain. The climate is perfect for outdoor retirement living, with swimming possible nearly year-round and no harsh winters. Spring and autumn are particularly pleasant with comfortable temperatures.

faqs.question: Hvor langt er det fra Norge til Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is easily accessible from the UK. Alicante Airport is 45 minutes from San Miguel de Salinas with numerous direct flights to UK airports (typically 2-2.5 hour flight time). Budget airlines offer affordable flights year-round, making visits from family convenient and cost-effective. Direct flights connect to London, Manchester, Birmingham, and other major UK airports.

faqs.question: Kan jeg få boliglån i Spania som utlending?
faqs.answer: Yes, many Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign buyers. Typically you'll need 30-40% deposit with the balance financed over 20-30 years. Interest rates are competitive, and English-speaking mortgage advisors are readily available. Many retirees purchase outright given the property's affordable price, eliminating mortgage considerations entirely.

faqs.question: Hva koster det å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Buying costs in Spain include: transfer tax (6-11%), notary fees (approximately 1%), legal fees (1-2%), and registration costs (0.5-1%). Total acquisition costs typically amount to 9-15% of purchase price. At €329,990, total costs would be approximately €30,000-50,000. Your solicitor provides a detailed breakdown before proceeding.

faqs.question: Trenger jeg visum for å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: No visa is required specifically to purchase property in Spain. EU citizens have residency rights under EU law. Non-EU citizens can buy property freely without residency. However, if planning to spend significant time in Spain, you may wish to explore residency options separately from the property purchase. Legal advice is recommended for your specific circumstances.
